Data Item: Has a reporting company been appointed
Business Rules: When 'Has a reporting company been appointed' = No, then an error page advising the user that they will need to appoint a reporting company will be displayed and the use will not be able to continue with the return

Data Item: Agent Acting On Behalf of company?
Name of Agent
Business Rules:
Must be completed if item 1.2 - Agent acting on behalf of company is = YES
An Error message will be displayed if data is not provided

Data Item: Is this an Abbreviated or Full return
Business Rules: An Error message will be displayed if data is not provided

Data Item: Reporting company name
Data validation:
String
Companies House Character Validation
min 1 max 160 chars
Business Rules: An Error message will be displayed if data is not provided

Data Item: UK Tax reference - CT UTR
Data validation:
10 digits
min 10, max 10
Use UTR Check Sum to validate the UTR
Business Rules: An Error message will be displayed if data is not provided

Data Item: Is the reporting Company the same as the ultimate parent?
Business Rules:
If answer = YES, the Ultimate Parent Company details will not be populated as details are already captured in reporting company details
  
If answer = No, then capture Ultimate Parent Company or Deemed parent company section details 
An Error message will be displayed if data is not provided
NOTE: If Reporting Company is same as the Ultimate Parent company, The Ultimate parent company details are not required for manual entry. (Not displayed)

ID: Ultimate Parent Company or Deemed Parent Company
Business Rules:
General rules:
The data items captured will be the same for Ultimate Parent Company or Deemed Parent.
The return MUST identify if it is an Ultimate Parent Company or Deemed entities (companies)
The return cannot have both an Ultimate Parent company AND Deemed parents companies
When deemed, there MUST be a minimum or two and up to three Deemed entities (companies)

ID: Parent company -  UK tax presence (If non-UK, see section below from item 11)

Data Item:
(Ultimate or Deemed Parent )
Ultimate Parent company registered name
OR
Deemed company name
Mandatory (M)/Optional(O): M if not a deemed company
Business Rules:
An Error message will be displayed if an Ultimate Parent Company name or Deemed Company name is not provided
An Error message will be displayed if an Ultimate Parent Company name AND a Deemed Company name is provided

Data Item:
(Ultimate or Deemed Parent )
CT UTR
Mandatory (M)/Optional(O): M if = UKand No SA UTR
Business Rules:
Mandatory if a UK tax presence parent company 
An Error message will be displayed if data is not provided
·  If CT UTR is present, then 'Country of incorporation' cannot be present

Data Item:
(Ultimate or Deemed Parent)
SA UTR
Mandatory (M)/Optional(O): M if = UK and no CT UTR is entered
Business Rules: An SA UTR must be provided if the Parent Company is a Limited Liability Partnership (LLP) or NO CT UTR is present

ID: Parent Company -  Non- UK tax presence

Data Item:
Ultimate Parent company registered name
OR
Deemed company name
Business Rules: An Error message will be displayed if data is not provided

Data Item:
(Ultimate or Deemed Parent )
Country of incorporation
Data validation:
2 chars
Stored as  ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format
Business Rules:
Display country name to user
If 'Country of incorporation' is present, then 'CT UTR'cannot be present

Data Item: Legal Entity Identifier
Business Rules: LEI is an alpha numerical field that is 20 characters in length

Data Item: Number of UK companies in the group
Business Rules:
Derived figure from the number of companies listed in section - List all UK Group companies
(When the 'List all UK Group companies' has been completed, then the calculated number of entries in the list will be populated in this data item)

Data Item: Inclusion of non consenting companies in relation to this return Y/N
Business Rules:
Where a company in the list of UK companies has declared they are non-consenting, then item 'Inclusion of non consenting companies in relation to this return' = YES
Where no company in the list of UK companies has declared they are non-consenting, then item 'Inclusion of non consenting companies in relation to this return' = No

Data Item: Start date of worldwide group of account
Data validation:
standard GDS date format
dd/mm/yyyy
Date can not be before 01/10/16
Business Rules:
Cannot be a future date
Back-end date to be stored as : ISO 8601 YYYY-MM-DD
An Error message will be displayed if data is not provided
NOTE: No rules required on how far in the past a start date can be. Rules suffice on the End date.

Data Item: End date of worldwide group of account
Data validation:
standard GDS date format 
dd/mm/yyyy
End dates can't be before 1st April 2017.
Business Rules:
The end date must be a min of 1 day and a max of 18 months after the start date 
Error will be displayed if the end date is more than 18 months after the start date .
Back-end date to be stored as : ISO 8601 YYYY-MM-DD
An Error message will be displayed if data is not provided

Data Item: Is this an original or revised return
Business Rules: An Error message will be displayed if data is not provided

Data Item: Ways in which revised return differs from the return it supersedes
Business Rules:
Mandatory when return is revised
An Error message will be displayed if data is not provided

Data Item: Group ratio election
Business Rules:
If Group ratio election is NO then the Fixed Ratio method will be used for the calculation of basic interest allowance
If Group ratio election = Yes, then the following data items below must be completed: 
Item 5.2- Qualifying net group-interest expense (QNGIE)
Item 5.3 - Group-EBITDA
Item 5.4 Group ratio percentage
If Group ratio election =No, then 5.2, 5.3 & 5.4 are NOT Required. 
An Error message will be displayed if Group ratio election is not provided

Data Item: Group ratio (blended) election
Business Rules:
Required if item 5.1 - Group ratio election = Yes
If Group ratio (blended) election = Yes, then one or more investor groups must be entered, (item 5.6  Over ruled by the business rule in 5.6 which states that an investor group is optional when Group ratio (blended) election = Yes
An Error message will be displayed if Yes/NO is not selected

Data Item: Investor group(s) to which election relates
Data validation:
List [String]
For each investor group named, capture What elections have been made/not made
Name : String, min 1 , max 160
If the Investor group is using Group ratio election, then show the following list
Group ratio (blended) election
Group EBITDA (chargeable gains) election
Interest allowance (alternative calculation) election
Interest allowance (non-consolidated investment) election
Interest allowance (consolidated partnership election
 
If the Investor group is using Fixed ratio election, then show the following list
Group EBITDA (chargeable gains) election
Interest allowance (alternative calculation) election
Interest allowance (non-consolidated investment) election
Interest allowance (consolidated partnership election
Business Rules:
ONLY available where a group ratio election is made.(item 5.1)
The group CAN (not must) specify one or more investor groups, and treat this/these as having made or not made other elections

Data Item: Has Group EBITDA (chargeable gains) election been previously elected?
Business Rules:
Relevant for both fixed ratio or group ratio methods. 
An Error message will be displayed if data is not provided

Data Item:
Group EBITDA (chargeable gains) election
(Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation and Amortisation)
Business Rules: Item irrevocable

Data Item: Interest allowance adjusted net group-interest expense (ANGIE) amount
Data validation:
monetary value
allow for over 1 billion £s
allow for 2 decimal places
no negative amounts allowed
Business Rules:
ANGIE cannot be negative;
if the result of the calculations is negative, ANGIE is = nil.
Required for both Group and Fixed Ratio calculations 
An Error message will be displayed if data is not provided

Data Item: Interest allowance (alternative calculation) election
Business Rules:
Relevant for both fixed ratio or group ratio methods. 
An Error message will be displayed if data is not provided
Item irrevocable (but we do not have access to previous returns to see if this has previously been elected)

Data Item: Interest allowance (alternative calculation) active
Business Rules:
Relevant for both fixed ratio or group ratio methods. 
An Error message will be displayed if data is not provided

Data Item: Interest allowance (non-consolidated investment) election
Business Rules:
Relevant for both the fixed ratio and the group ratio methods
When Interest allowance (non-consolidated investment) election = Yes, then one or more non-consolidated associates of the worldwide group must be entered on the return. (see item 5.9)
Can also elect item 5.7 - Interest allowance (consolidated partnerships) election 
An Error message will be displayed if data is not provided

Data Item: Interest allowance (non-consolidated investment) active
Business Rules:
Relevant for both fixed ratio or group ratio methods. 
An Error message will be displayed if data is not provided

Data Item: Interest allowance (consolidated partnerships) election
Business Rules:
Relevant for both the fixed ratio and the group ratio methods.
 When Interest allowance (consolidated partnerships) election is elected, a Partnership or partnerships to which election relates to must be entered (item 5.14)
An Error message will be displayed if data is not provided
Item irrevocable (but we do not have access to previous returns to see if this has previously been elected)

Data Item: Interest allowance (consolidated partnerships) active
Business Rules:
Relevant for both fixed ratio or group ratio methods. 
An Error message will be displayed if data is not provided

Data Item: Has a company made a qualifying infrastructure company election?
Business Rules: NOTE: Election lasts for 5 years

Data Item: Non-consolidated investment(s) to which election relates
Business Rules:
MUST specify one or more non-consolidated associates of the worldwide group when Item 5.10 -Interest allowance (non-consolidated investment) election is made.
Item irrevocable (but we do not have access to previous returns to see if this has previously been elected)
An Error message will be displayed if data is not provided

Data Item: Partnership or partnerships to which election relates
Data validation:
Names of each Partnership/s -
Name : String, min 1 , max 160
List of
min elements 1, max element 32767
Business Rules:
Can be a UK Partnership or a Non UK Partnership
MUST identify the consolidated partnership when item 5.11 - Interest allowance (consolidated partnerships) election is elected
If UK Partnership - request an SA UTR - item 5.15
An Error message will be displayed if data is not provided

Data Item: UK Partnership SA UTR

ID: 6. About the companies involved - data for each UK company

A company is eligible if and only if the company:
(a) was a UK group company at a time during the specified period of account,
and (b) was not dormant throughout that period.

Data Item: UK Group Company Name
Data validation:
String
Alpha numeric - min 1 max 160 chars
Validation to be same as that for Companies House
Business Rules: An Error message will be displayed if data is not provided

Data Item: UK Tax reference -CT unique taxpayer reference (UTR)
Data validation:
10 digit numerical
(min 10 max 10 chars, use UTR Checksum below)
Business Rules: An Error message will be displayed if data is not provided

Data Item: Enter N if non-consenting
Business Rules: An Error message will be displayed if data is not provided

Data Item: Declaration
Business Rules: If return does not meet declaration criteria then it is deemed invalid
